dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5136 IH: Supporting Transportation Organization and Refrigeration Expansion Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Bonamici (for herself and Ms. Schrier) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To address infrastructure needs for food banks serving rural communities and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Transportation Organization and Refrigeration Expansion Act of 2023 or STORE Act of 2023.

section.header: Improving the EFAP infrastructure grants program
section.text: Section 209 of the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7511a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a) by striking an emergency feeding organization and inserting the State agency designated by a State in the State plan required by section 202A (7 U.S.C. 7503),

subparagraph.text: by striking the heading and inserting Preference,
by inserting Tribal, low income, and remote before communities, and
in subparagraph (A) by striking and inserting rural with these,
by striking carry out activities of the eligible entity and inserting distribute grant amounts to support activities,
in paragraph (1) by striking for the tracking of time-sensitive food products and inserting needed to safely and efficiently distribute food to people in need,
in paragraph (2) by striking time-sensitive and perishable food products and inserting commodities provided by the Secretary under this Act and commodities secured from other sources,

clause.text: by striking through the support of small or mid-size farms and ranches, fisheries, and aquaculture, and donations from local food producers and manufacturers to persons in need, and
by inserting , including expanding mobile and home delivery options and assessments or professional studies of outreach activities after United States,

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4) by inserting , governmental, and Tribal after nonprofit, and

clause.text: in subparagraph (B) by inserting , governmental, and Tribal after nonprofit, and

subclause.text: by striking rural areas and inserting underserved areas identified in subsection (b)(2), and
by striking and at the end,

clause.text: by striking constructing and inserting renovating, and
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and, and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: not more than 4 percent of such grant for administrative costs to carry this section.
in subsection (d) by striking $15,000,000 and all that follows through 2023, and inserting $25,000,000 for each of the fiscal years 2024 through 2028.

section.header: Report on cold storage needs nationally

subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall carry out a study and produce a report—

paragraph.text: on the shortages to meet the total emergency food needs for refrigerated and frozen storage space, as well as refrigerated trucks and other delivery vehicles, for use by emergency food organizations to meet the needs of their communities, and
an estimate of the cost to meet the needs of all emergency food organizations, including food banks and food pantries, nationally for new coolers, freezers, refrigerated and dry trucks, and trailers.

The term emergency food organization has the meaning given it in section 2 of the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7501) and is not otherwise limited to relevant organizations participating in the emergency food assistance program under such Act.

The term shortages means meeting the total emergency food needs of the community, group, school, network, region, town, city, state, or otherwise relevant area an emergency feeding organization serves.

subsection.text: There is appropriated, out of any funds in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $1,000,000, to remain available until expended, to carry out this section.
